Tell me how to find that


--- AI Assistant ---

Actually, the specific steps to check your ObjectStore version can depend on how it's installed and used in your environment, but here are the most common ways:

1. Command Line:

  • Open a command prompt or terminal window on the server where ObjectStore is installed.
  • Run the following command: 
    osserver -version
    or 
    osadmin -version
    This should display the installed ObjectStore version.

2. Check the About Section:

  • If you use a graphical interface or management tool for ObjectStore, look for an “About” menu or section. The version number is often listed there.

3. Review Release Notes or Documentation:

  • Sometimes, the version is documented in your deployment or installation notes.

If you try these steps and still can't find the version, let me know how you're accessing ObjectStore (command line, GUI, etc.), and I can tailor the instructions further!


--- Customer (Asad Khalil) ---

Ok tell me about what Objectstore is


--- AI Assistant ---

ObjectStore is an embedded object-oriented database management system (DBMS). Essentially, it’s designed to store, manage, and retrieve complex data as objects—just like you use in object-oriented programming. This makes it a great fit for applications that need reliable, transactional object persistence and real-time data caching.

Think of ObjectStore as a specialized filing cabinet for your software’s objects, allowing you to save and retrieve them quickly and efficiently, without having to convert them into tables or rows like in traditional relational databases.

If you’d like to learn more about recent releases or features, you can check out the official documentation, such as the announcement for ObjectStore Standard 2024.2 here: Announcing ObjectStore Standard 2024.2 General Availability.

Let me know if you want more details about how it works or what makes it unique!

Here's what I found about ObjectStore's history and release timeline:

  • ObjectStore was originally created in the late 1980s as one of the first commercial object-oriented database management systems. It has a long history of supporting complex, object-based applications.

  • The latest update is ObjectStore Standard 2025.1. You can find the release notes here: ObjectStore Standard 2025.1 Release Notes.

  • As for the next planned release, there isn't any publicly available information or official announcement about future release dates. ObjectStore typically announces new versions through their official channels, so it's best to keep an eye on their documentation or support portal for updates.
